metadata.title: CVE-2019-10912 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: In Symfony before 2.8.50, 3.x before 3.4.26, 4.x before 4.1.12, and 4.2.x before 4.2.7, it is possible to cache objects that may contain bad user input. On serialization or unserialization, this could result in the deletion of files that the current user has access to. This is related to symfony/cache and symfony/phpunit-bridge.

criterions.comment: symfony package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.22+dfsg-2').
